intro: Tryphostemma humile, commonly known as the small milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a climbing vine, with opposite, ovate leaves and showy, yellowish or greenish flowers. Its flowers are often clustered in umbels and are pollinated by insects. The plant contains cardiac glycosides, which can be toxic to livestock and humans if ingested.
